<GameName>Señorita El Chupacabra</GameName>
<CONTENT>
<strong>Funny West</strong><br>A Third person shooter in the crazy version of Wild West where steampunk meets magic, also, human races are living next to fantasy creatures.<br><br>So Players not only use steampunk-style weapons but also the magic that can enchant inventory, attack the enemy or curse them.<br><br>Each race has its advantages and disadvantages and sometimes they have unique inventory so be prepared to meet for example tough ogres, dwarves with high-tech weapons and Indians with their ancestor magic.<br><br><strong>Maria El Chupacabra</strong><br>The main protagonist in this story, a young vampire lady decided to take other life paths than being a regular housekeeper, so she decided to become a bounty hunter.<br>So she leads her first steps to Devil's Canyon where locals sometimes have a hot temperament.<br>Maybe she is weak as a young lady, but keep in mind that she is a vampire and she has some magic tricks like hypnotizing enemies to gain control of them and unique weapons like...<br><br>...rolling pin.<br><br><strong>Gameplay</strong><br>The gameplay refers to the games of the past where finding stuff is more usable like finding ammo for Maria's Superweapon.<br>Depending on the game development, for now, will be the closed location from point A to point B, but the latter maybe will be a chance for a small open world.

<GameName>Bebop</GameName>
<CONTENT>
Set in a distant future, a dystopian society struggles with crime and prostitution. In a dark alley, a sign on the door reads: &quot;Bebop, private investigator&quot;. But is he a private investigator really? I DON'T THINK SO. Bebop is involved with the mob, and he is about to embark on a journey without return. I mean, he will return home, but NOT THE SAME as before. Bebop will meet people that will shape his personality, he will go after those who wronged him, and he will, in the end, reach the end of his story. OR IS HE?<br />
<br />
This amazing adventure was written by Luis Felipe Pimenta, in his first attempt at creating a game. Hopefully, it won't be his last. His team is made of programmers doing artwork and artists doing programming.<br />
<br />
Bebop is a platform side-scroller pixel art adventure. Use physics to solve puzzles, travel through different places in Cybercity to complete your quests. <br />
<br />
Features:<br />
<br />
- 2D Physics puzzles<br />
- Choices that matter and affect your ending<br />
- Tough ethical decisions to make<br />
- Tightly crafted platforming action and deeply emotional storytelling<br />
- Exploring options: to find hidden levels, equipment and more storytelling<br />
- Use drugs to jump higher<br />
- Well-designed maps: with traps and cyberpunk ambiences<br />
- Challenging bosses

<GameId>2208730</GameId>
<GameName>Raiders of Ruin</GameName>
<CONTENT>
In Raiders of Ruin, you guide a group of 5 champions sent on a quest to seize the throne of the Underworld itself. Along the way, you will encounter many deadly bosses and engage in challenging, strategic turn-based combat. You decide how to build your party, mixing-and-matching between 9 different classes, each with drastically different strengths and weaknesses. You can change classes any time, so experiment frequently to craft the perfect strategy for each enemy!<h2 class="bb_tag">Features</h2><ul class="bb_ul"><li>Over <strong>40 boss fights,</strong> each with their own unique mechanics. Expect multiple phases, colourful gimmicks, and ruthless attacks. <br></li><li><strong>No game-overs:</strong> Your progress is saved after every battle. Defeat simply means a chance to try again. <br></li><li>Study your enemies ahead of time by viewing the <strong>Boss Log,</strong> where you can find a record of your greatest foes and a description of their attacks. You must prepare to counter their strategies with a plan of your own!<br></li><li>Class-based combat system that's simple to learn, hard to master. <strong>Swap classes before any battle</strong> to arm yourself for the fight ahead. Find a combo that works for you and stick to it, or experiment frequently to find the perfect squad. <br></li><li><strong>9 main classes to choose from.</strong> Need more firepower? Swap that Paladin for a Wizard. Expecting a long fight? Try poisoning your foe with a Rogue.<br></li><li><strong>Multiple subclasses</strong> for most classes, providing even more customization. Should your Ranger be a Hunter, or a Survivalist?<br></li><li><strong>Innovative rematch system</strong> that replaces traditional level-grinding. Instead of fighting normal enemies repeatedly, you will occasionally be given the opportunity to rematch a boss of your choosing for a second chance at its rewards (though this system is entirely optional). <br></li><li><strong> MIDI soundtrack</strong> inspired by PC games of the early 2000's, with some modern twists. <br></li><li>A backpack that might be alive?</li></ul><br>-------------------------------------------------<br><br><i>&quot;I won't waste my time trying to plead with you. We all know how this has to end. <br>So...<br><br>Are you ready for battle?&quot;</i> 
</CONTENT>

<GameId>2208930</GameId>
<GameName>Space Time</GameName>
<CONTENT>
Hello and welcome to Space Time! Your goal is to shoot and destroy space rocks to raise your score. The real enemy is the clock...that's right time itself is against you. There are 3 game modes Mission Critical requires 1000 points more each level, Double Down which requires double the score of the last level and Defiance which pits your score against an enemy score in a tug of war style endurance match.  Unlock all 9 (including 2 secret) ships each with their own strengths and weaknesses.  Enjoy beautiful backgrounds and an amazing sound track as you blast your targets away. Have fun unlocking all 25 Achievements and get that 100%. Space Time was designed so that it can be played one-handed with either hand for those who suffer from an injury or disability which prevents the use of both hands. Thank you again for your interest in my game, this is my first and I hope to make many many more.<br><img src="https://cdn.akamai.steamstatic.com/steam/apps/2208930/extras/imageedit_1_2346081554.png?t=1670130087" />

<GameId>2208940</GameId>
<GameName>Geometric Hell</GameName>
<CONTENT>
Geometric Hell is an arcade bullet-hell shooter with minimalistic graphics. Survive waves of aggressive geometric shapes and upgrade to keep up with the progressive increase in difficulty. Defeating bosses rewards you with special upgrades. Many deaths are expected before you get a chance to fight the final boss. Between attempts, you should keep track of your achievements as they reward you with points used for permanent upgrades.<br><br><br><br><strong>Player</strong><br><br>The player can move around withing the play area and shoot enemies. The player can also dash, dashing makes the player temporarily invulnerable to most damage in the game, while also dealing massive damage to any enemies you collide with. Other ways of dealing damage is unlocked by defeating bosses.<br><br><br><br><strong>Enemies and Upgrades</strong><br><br>There is currently 6 different types of shapes, each shape has 4 variants: Normal, Elite, Miniboss and Boss. However, the final boss is unique. Defeating enemies rewards you with points used to upgrade at any time, while attempting the game. While upgrading you get 3 alternatives to spend your points on, or you could spend a small amount to refresh. Each unique upgrade can be upgraded 9 times and all prices increase every time you buy an upgrade.<br><br>Additionally, bosses awards special upgrades, which then will be added to the upgrade system where they can be upgraded further. They can also be upgraded if it's rewarded multiple times from defeating bosses.<br><br><br><br><strong>Achievements</strong><br><br>54 achievement points are currently available, and can be freely added to and removed from upgrades in the achievement menu. This progress is permanent and increases your chances of beating the game. 
</CONTENT>
</GAME>

<GAME>
<GameId>2208960</GameId>
<GameName>Gravity</GameName>
<CONTENT>
This is a physics, logic puzzle game where the aim is to guide the ball to the exit within 20 seconds on each level. Each puzzle starts with all objects and the ball as static.<br />
You can move and rotate yellow and orange objects into different positions. When you are happy with there placement press play to turn gravity on. <br />
With gravity turned on The ball and all green and yellow objects will fall and be affected by physics. For example, you might need to move a yellow object out of the way so the ball can roll to the exit, or place a ramp under the ball so it rolls down it when it falls.<br />
There are 4 main object types;<br />
The Red Ball(s) - Can not be moved, affected by gravity. Level complete when the ball reaches the exit<br />
Yellow - Can be moved, affected by gravity.<br />
Green - Can not be moved, affected by gravity.<br />
Orange - Can be Moved, not affected by gravity.<br />
<br />
The game features<br />
- 75 levels!<br />
-Time Trials for every level<br />
-Unlockable balls, for completing challenges.<br />
-Level editor 
</CONTENT>
</GAME>

<GameId>2228840</GameId>
<GameName>Whispers of West Grove</GameName>
<CONTENT>
Waking up in an asylum as one of its patients, you realize the doctor in charge has horrible plans for you. However, when you fall asleep, that's when you realize the true horrors of your situation. Your dreams are plagued by an alternate version of the asylum, where monsters inhabit the facility, and the laws of reality have been left behind. Using a modified flashlight with 3 different modes you discover that your world can be changed at the press of a button. Using this you can solve puzzles, defeat monsters, and explore parts of the asylum that defy reality to find your escape.<h2 class="bb_tag">Gameplay &amp; Features</h2><img src="https://cdn.akamai.steamstatic.com/steam/apps/2228840/extras/waterfall_steam_.gif?t=1670604461" /><br><ul class="bb_ul"><li>Puzzles &amp; Riddles<br></li><li>Multiple rooms and locations to explore<br></li><li>Story items to collect<br></li><li>Multiple weapons to find<br></li><li>Player powers<br></li><li>Merchants &amp; Upgrading<br></li><li>Boss fights<br></li><li>Multiple endings</li></ul><h2 class="bb_tag">Developer Inspiration</h2><img src="https://cdn.akamai.steamstatic.com/steam/apps/2228840/extras/EnemyStun_steam_.png?t=1670604461" /><br>When I started this project I didn't want to make a game with cheap jump scares or classic horror clichés. I wanted to create an experience that genuinely surprises the player and makes them feel like they never truly know what's going to happen next. From day one, I've always wanted the world to feel alive and story-wise it needs to. The world you exist in is not one based in reality and is carefully crafted to the player's actions in the game. The way you play changes the world around you, and I thought this was a really concept to explore. 
</CONTENT>

<GameName>Project Astra Dominium</GameName>
<CONTENT>
Project Astra Dominium is a Tower Defense game with Basebuilding and Automation elements.<br>Build up your base to become a supply hub for Earth's desperately needed materials, gather resources while defending against an unknown alien threat and improve your tower's and AI capabilities.<h2 class="bb_tag">Story</h2>It's the year 2249, most resources on earth are nearly depleted and have lead to many conflicts in the past. <br>Despite those crises, humanity made huge progress in the fields of AI, which in turn allowed for enormous advances in space travel.<br>Scientists were even able to create a new kind of engine, which made it possible to travel faster than light. But on the downside humans were not able to survive this way of transportation.<br>In a last desperate attempt and in search for new resources, the EIRO (European Interstellar Resource Organization) built a brand new ship which was only controlled by an AI named &quot;Athena&quot;.<br>Hoping that the AI can survive the jump and begin autonomous exploration and exploitation of resources, the ship is launched into an unknown future...<h2 class="bb_tag">Expand</h2>Make use of the latest Nanite technology to process and refine all resources you find into useful materials for earth or new equipment for your towers.<h2 class="bb_tag">Fight</h2>Explore different planets and defend against a mysterious alien race, that seem to reproduce endlessly and eat up whole planets.<h2 class="bb_tag">Grow</h2>As an AI you learn from everything you do and become stronger and better.<br><ul class="bb_ul"><li>Gain combat experience and skillpoints that you can use to improve your towers. Each tower has it's own skilltree with up to 250 points to spend!<br></li><li>Learn recipes to craft various materials, items and also equipment for your towers.<br></li><li>Improve your crafting abilities and effiency to use less resources while having <br>more/better/faster output.<br></li><li>Discover more about the aliens and learn to craft special beacons, that attract much stronger species that may also yield much better rewards!<br></li><li>Expand and improve your base to become a reliable resource hub for earth.</li></ul><h2 class="bb_tag">DISCLAIMER</h2>Project Astra Dominium ist still in early access.<br><br>While most of the gameplay elements are already implemented, the visuals and UX are still work in progress and not finished yet.<br>We will update all screenshots/videos accordingly, whenever there is progress made in those areas! 
</CONTENT>
</GAME>
<GAME>
<GameId>2228320</GameId>
<GameName>Feisty Festivities</GameName>
<CONTENT>
<strong>What is Feisty Festivities?</strong><br>Feisty Festivities is a online multiplayer shooter-style snowball fight game. The goal is to join or create a match, and just eliminate other players. The base game-mode is free-for-all (FFA), meaning that you attack everything and everyone with no remorse.<br><br><strong>What features does it have?</strong><br>Currently, the game includes features such as:<br><ul class="bb_ul">- Double Jumping</ul><ul class="bb_ul">- Proximity Chat</ul><ul class="bb_ul">- Custom Matches</ul><ul class="bb_ul">- 2 maps to select from</ul><br><strong>Gameplay</strong><br>After creating a match yourself or joining one, you will get put into the map that was selected by the host. Leaving the spawn area, you can press <strong>E</strong> to pick a snowball while you're on the ground. <strong>Left-clicking</strong> throws the snowball, and if you hit the enemy, they die and they have to wait until they respawn. Jumping while airborne enables you to jump again, and <i>open</i> proximity chat allows the player to communicate with others. Be careful not to use up all your stamina, or you'll have to wait until it recharges!<br><br>Please note: when creating a match, you can choose the map you'd like. 
</CONTENT>
</GAME>

<GameId>2227820</GameId>
<GameName>山海：传承</GameName>
<CONTENT>
<u><strong>国风重彩、江山如画</strong></u>（画风）<br>在特色国风画面之中，感受千年文化的底蕴。<br><br><u><strong>上承天命、下安黎民</strong></u>（天命、人口）<br>在外敌和天灾的威胁中维护帝国的统治、安抚民心，后世会认可您的功绩。您将经历数个朝代并达成统一、建设奇观、文化融合、使四方朝贡等朝代目标，最终打造一个盛世王朝。<br><br><u><strong>论道经邦、政由己出</strong></u>（国策、权力）<br>安国养民或是穷兵黩武，亲自推行您的国策，让这庞大的帝国根据您的意志运作。不过还请留意，民力有限，权衡轻重也是天子应当思虑之事。<br>天子的意志需要由人来执行，同时也会产生利益与派系，维持士族、宦官、外戚或党派之间的平衡也是帝王之术的一部分。<br><br><u><strong>诸子争鸣、博采众长</strong></u>（学说）<br>选择您所推行思想——儒、墨、道、法、阴阳、名、兵，或各取所长。提取各家理论的精华成为国策。使文化形成传承并让外敌同化于您帝国的强大文化影响之下。<br><br><u><strong>内平诸国、外御其辱</strong></u>（战争）<br>扫荡华夏大地上的其他诸侯、抵御各方外敌的入侵，在丰富的科技树中解锁强力的兵种、发展完备的军事制度。编制合理的部队，关注部队的士气和后勤，其他们成为您手中矛与盾。<br><br><u><strong>星宿闪耀、器具璀璨</strong></u>（星宿、文物）<br>天上有群星构建的天宫，地上有工匠打造的器具。建造观星台并向二十八星宿祈愿，收集各类名器，这都将为您的帝国带来强大的加成。<br><br><u><strong>千古逸闻、游历江湖</strong></u>（事件、江湖）<br>在您统治帝国的过程中，您将经历许多丰富的事件，如白泽到访、玄奘取经等，也有着江湖传闻、民生民情。这些事件将基于您的选择带来不同的发展，事件最终的结果不仅会影响您的天命，还会影响您的整个帝国。<br>您可以派遣一位您的心腹游历江湖体察民情，从而得知在您治下百姓的生活是否安稳富足、或对您心有不满。您也可以选择让这位心腹在各处除暴安良，稳定当地的民心，甚至于建立江湖帮派来执行各式各样的谋划。如何利用皆取决于您。<br><br>微博：@薮羽制作组<br>粉丝群：QQ707450152 
</CONTENT>
</GAME>

<h2 class="bb_tag">War chess + Card + Rogue, Experience a new game of war chess!</h2><br>&quot;TRoA&quot; is a new strategy game based on war chess, supplemented by card logic and Rogue system.<br>You will control the &quot;Controller&quot;, defeat all enemies in the foggy forest level after level, and uncover the secrets of the different world &quot;Astra Continent&quot;......<br>At the same time, the &quot;LeadingLights&quot; in the classroom seem to be hiding something...<br><br><br>In the combat part of &quot;TRoA&quot;, inherited from the classic chess rules, chess pieces can <strong>&quot;upgrade&quot;</strong>, through upgrading, most pieces can get higher values ​​and more powerful abilities And a wider range of movement! Make good use of the upgrade effect to be invincible in battle!<br><br>The <strong>&quot;Engrave&quot;</strong> obtained after each battle can be equipped on chess pieces, and more engraves of different styles can be unlocked as the game progresses. There are different linking effects between engravings, choose a suitable style, and challenge the powerful enemies in the foggy forest!<br><br>A total of 14 non-repetitive boss battles, as well as many normal and difficult monsters, among which the boss has at least 10 to 27 different skills, and 1 to 8 matching passives. Challenge the limit under the heavy pressure of the boss!<br><br>There are many different events in the Rogue part, which may strengthen, weaken, or obtain new chess pieces, etc...<br><br>In addition to &quot;Astra Continent&quot;, it seems that the classroom will also change as the level progresses...<br><br>In addition to challenging levels, you can also chat with your classmates, maybe you can learn something?

<GameId>2227690</GameId>
<GameName>Vampiric Tower Remix</GameName>
<CONTENT>
Victoria the Vampire ascends the Vampiric Tower once more!<br><br>A brand-new game featuring rooms from both Vampiric Tower 1 &amp; 2, as well as plenty of new ones. Plus, it has all new graphics and music! And it's much easier than 2!<br><br>For the uninitiated, Vampiric Tower is a box-pushing puzzle game. The original game was made way back in 2000, when I was 16. Vampiric Tower Remix is the best &amp; definitive entry of the series!<br><br>Push the boxes around to block the spells from the Pumpkins and the Ghosts. Try to pick up all the vials in each room without getting zapped, and then get to the exit! If you do get zapped, do not fret! You have unlimited lives in this game, so just try again!<br><br>Turn into a bat to fly over spikes, water, pots, and other stuff in your way! Cast ice spells to turn the denizens of the tower into ice cubes that you can push around! Rock out to amazing chiptune remixes of Mozart classics!<br><br>Featuring 15 worlds with 8 rooms each, for 120 rooms total. The 15 worlds are divided into 5 episodes of 3 worlds each. The worlds in each episode can be tackled in any order.<br><br>Let’s check out those worlds!<br><br><ul class="bb_ul"><li><strong>The Old Tower</strong>: Featuring classics from the original game! Get re-acquainted with the Pumpkins and Ghosts!<br></li><li><strong>Jiangshi Junction</strong>: The Jiangshis hop around and stop in place if they touch Victoria.<br></li><li><strong>Faerie Gardens</strong>: Faeries move back and forth to block Victoria’s progress. Nothing a well-placed ice spell can’t fix!<br></li><li><strong>Magick Library</strong>: Say hello to the Witches! They are intently reading their books, but when the last vial is collected, look out!<br></li><li><strong>Tomb of the Sun</strong>: The Mummies can be frozen, but they’ll fall apart afterward. Since you can only freeze them once, make it count!<br></li><li><strong>Bodacious Botany</strong>: These alien plants from Venus just won’t stop re-growing!<br></li><li><strong>Medusa’s Lair</strong>: Like the Witches, the Snakes wake up when all vials are collected. Their fireballs move pretty fast!<br></li><li><strong>Atlantean Shrine</strong>: The Shades cast ice spells, just like Victoria!<br></li><li><strong>Lil’ Bot Factory</strong>: The industrious Lil’ Bots walk back and forth, pushing boxes, pots, flasks, or anything else they find.<br></li><li><strong>Ethereal Palace</strong>: Imps like to bop back and forth and get in the way. Silly Imps!<br></li><li><strong>World Tree Roots</strong>: The Sorceresses have mastered a spell that can travel through pillars and pots, just like the Pumpkins and Ghosts! Luckily, it moves much slower than theirs.<br></li><li><strong>The Pearly Gates</strong>: The Doubles are perfect copies of Victoria. Whatever she does, they follow!<br></li><li><strong>Awesome Alchemy</strong>: Wisps move about and disintegrate when they touch Victoria. They have no resolve!<br></li><li><strong>All Hail Mars</strong>: The formidable Knights are invincible and immune to all magic.<br></li><li><strong>The Grand Finale</strong>: Put your skills to the test in the final world!</li></ul><br>Can Victoria make it through the 120 rooms of this new tower? Play the game and find out!

<GameId>2227700</GameId>
<GameName>AstroDrop</GameName>
<CONTENT>
AstroDrop is a 2D platformer about an astronaut, called Astro, who is lost in space and wants to drop all the way back to Earth. The platform layout is meant to challenge the player by testing their memory, skill and patience.<h2 class="bb_tag"> Gameplay</h2><br>-You can jump and air strafe.<br>-There is fall damage and when you die you go back to the beginning of the level.<br>-As you progress downwards, the gravity scale changes (fall damage becomes more punishing, you run faster and slide faster).<br>-There are flying objects that can end your attempts such as asteroids or birds.<br>-Additionally, there are parts of the terrain that can also kill you such as spikes, falling spikes and lava.<br>-There is only 1 checkpoint per level, and it is the start of that level.<br>-Every death and checkpoint are auto-saved.<br>-Overall, the gameplay is punishing but satisfying.<br>-This game is meant for gamers who want to challenge themselves.<br><br>AstroDrop was designed to be one of the hardest video games ever made. 
</CONTENT>
</GAME>

<GameName>Space Haste 2</GameName>
<CONTENT>
SPACE HASTE II is an adrenaline pumping, futuristic racing game that puts players in the driver’s seat of the hottest hovercrafts on the planet. The game continually analyzes the player’s skills and times, building up their hovercraft’s speed throughout the race according to their abilities. But there is no limit to how much speed they can accumulate and the fastest rides through the breathtaking missions and backdrops will undoubtedly be the best ones!<br><br><ul class="bb_ul"><li> 4 hovercrafts to choose from<br></li><li> Each hovercraft has 8 levels of enhancement<br></li><li> The better you are at driving, the quicker your hovercraft will enhance<br></li><li> Depending on your driving skills, the game keeps adding to the maximum speed of the hovercraft throughout the race<br></li><li> Hovercrafts actually have no speed limits<br></li><li> 11 pickups: Energy, Cloak, Bounce, Pilot, Blast, Boost, Flash, Stun, Drain, Shield and Haste<br></li><li> 3 race modes: Normal Race, Time Race and Shadow Racer</li></ul> 1 user reviewsI never imagined for the life of me that one of my favorite little bargain bin games growing up would ever make it on Steam. Literally like 10 people knew this game existed, and I was one of them.

A huge thank you to Dreams Interactive and Strategy First for giving this game a chance to to be discovered again, it's an amazing little hidden gem that's just as addictively fun to play as it was when I played it as a kid. Though relatively simple nowadays, this very grungy cyberpunk/industrial Wipeout clone captivated me growing up.

My only complaint is that they seem to have not implemented the music for the game, possibly due to licensing issues (though the music label still appears on billboards in game and the music track selector still has the names of the songs). Growing up, I know that the game wouldn't play the music unless you had the CD in the drive, but you could still play the game without the music if you didn't have the disc. It could be that they just didn't implement the features that were on disc. If you want, go ahead and buy this version, but if you can find a copy on disc, get that too so you can experience the game with the music as originally intended by the original developers.I never imagined for the life of me that one of my favorite little bargain bin games growing up would ever make it on Steam. Literally like 10 people knew this game existed, and I was one of them.

A huge thank you to Dreams Interactive and Strategy First for giving this game a chance to to be discovered again, it's an amazing little hidden gem that's just as addictively fun to play as it was when I played it as a kid. Though relatively simple nowadays, this very grungy cyberpunk/industrial Wipeout clone captivated me growing up.

My only complaint is that they seem to have not implemented the music for the game, possibly due to licensing issues (though the music label still appears on billboards in game and the music track selector still has the names of the songs). <h2 class="bb_tag">A Quest in Kindara</h2><br>When resource depletion leaves the human race on the brink of extinction, an exceptionally large source of iron is detected in a distance star system. As a last effort to save humanity, they send you, an Iron Extractor, to the planet where the target is located. <GameName>Ready, Steady, Ship!</GameName>
<CONTENT>
Oh no! The factory is swarming with orders to be shipped, so you and your colleagues are on a tight schedule! Each assignment is a ticking time bomb ready to explode and only the finest, most skillful shipping clerks will complete them. Space Draw is a VR creation tool with 3D painting as the main playing method. Users can easily draw a fantastic virtual world.<br />
<br />

<br />

<br />
Space Draw transforms the painting from a 2D plane to a 3D three-dimensional effect. It has clear visual hierarchy and more visual impact, enabling players to create as they wish.

<CONTENT>
Ansoku is a relaxing, fun, simple, and yet challenging puzzle game with a high replay value. <br />
<br />
The concept of the game is simple, use the given blocks to create rows, once a row is created it will be cleared and you receive the sum of its points and charge your rotate points. If however, you can no longer place any of the blocks you are given, the game will be over. <br />
<br />
Now also available on desktop, its main intent is to be a game that can be played when you just want to relax. It can run in its own smaller window so you can do things on the side if you wish. No time pressure, play at your own pace and you can stop the game at any time to return where you left off later.<br />

<strong>Greenlander</strong> is a brutal top-down action game set in Greenland during the mid-1500's. You play as a Norse settler who takes up the mantle of his Viking ancestors and embarks on a grim quest for revenge against the Sea Pirates that destroyed his home. <GameId>2204430</GameId>
<GameName>Ruler of the Waves 1916</GameName>
<CONTENT>
<i>Broadside thunder,<br>steel plate sundered,<br>munitions ablaze,<br>once triumphant -<br>sinking to a watery grave,<br>Ruler of the Waves.<br>- Inscriptus</i><br><br><br>Man the turrets of mighty Dreadnought battleships and battlecruisers and blow your enemy out of the water to secure your position as... the Ruler of the Waves!<br><br>Ruler of the Waves 1916 is a naval combat game and turret-based shooter. The main gameplay involves aiming and firing the turrets. Since turrets take 30 seconds to reload, the player must utilize multiple turrets on multiple ships to maximize their firepower. Things are made more difficult due to the movement of the ships and the sea, and consistent accuracy will be a challenge to all but the most experienced gunner. Sink all the enemy boats to achieve victory - with bonus points earned for quickness.<br><br>The game follows, in a fictional sense, the major battlecruiser engagements in WWI such as the Battles of Heligoland Bight and Jutland, which would be the last time ships of this kind reigned supreme before improvements to high-flying aircraft and deep-diving submarines made them all but obsolete. <br><br>Dreadnought-era battleships and battlecruisers are similar in size and firepower, but differ in terms of armor thickness, turret layout, and speed. Battleships are more heavily armored, whereas battlecruisers have the advantage in mobility. <br><br>The player will have an opportunity to board both types of ship and unleash mighty salvos upon the opposing fleet. 
</CONTENT>
</GAME>

Help Mr. Ball have a safe and comfortable trip 1 user reviewsI appreciate it's smooth controls. The game is just as described, every jump requires precision and patience for the right moments. I'm glad I wasn't able to save on my own and load the save if I fell, I feel like the challenge of the game would be reduced too much. Having to start from wherever you land is demoralizing, but I found it to be a part of the fun. Something I wasn't aware of at the start is how much your jump is charged, I was able to figure this out by seeing the light beneath Mr. Ball growing brighter.

<GameId>2204540</GameId>
<GameName>GrandStrategy</GameName>
<CONTENT>
It's a modern war that simulates a real battle, a conflict that might have happened.<br />
<br />
There are more than 200 kinds of tanks, armored vehicles, and aircraft in this movie.<br />
From the most advanced weapons to those that flourished during the Cold War!<br />
Some weapons are buried in history!<br />
A selection of UAVs and UGVs for modern warfare!<br />
The units are also free to buy equipment, or you can hire a dedicated PMC to dump them.<br />
<br />
The highlight is the Third World War! Over 100 powers, over 400 territories! Waiting time is so long!<br />
You can play freely! In the great power play, it is a pleasure to let money talk about things, gather nuclear weapons and shoot them in unison!<br />
It is also good to have a hard fight by tying up various things with small forces! You may lay down a small country with a large army!<br />
<br />
It also comes with a small storytelling scenario that covers all but major battles!<br />
In addition to that, it also includes small-scale conflicts such as the &quot;Battle of Malawi&quot; and IF's wars such as the &quot;Second Korean War&quot;!<br />
You can enjoy various big and small battles with this one piece!<br />
<br />
Also, this work was created in 2021, so it does not reflect the times.<br />
Please understand. 
</CONTENT>

<GameName>Field Tactics</GameName>
<CONTENT>
Field Tactics is a Turn-Based Tactical War Simulator inspired by ancient warfare. Set up your formations, utilise a variety of tactics and lead your army to victory.<br><br>There are 2 ways to win, either by capturing your opponents Commander, or by capturing every other piece.<h2 class="bb_tag">Pieces</h2><strong>Foot Soldier</strong><br>The most common piece at your disposal, they are hard workers who would give it their all for victory.<br><img src="https://cdn.akamai.steamstatic.com/steam/apps/2204570/extras/fs_gif.gif?t=1669834027" /><br><br><br><strong>Archer</strong><br>A vital piece in the army, they watch over the front lines and pray on those that would dare to step too close.<br><img src="https://cdn.akamai.steamstatic.com/steam/apps/2204570/extras/ar_gif.gif?t=1669834027" /><br><br><br><strong>Chariot</strong><br>Probably the most devastating weapons you can use, as they will mow down everything in their path.<br><img src="https://cdn.akamai.steamstatic.com/steam/apps/2204570/extras/cht_gif.gif?t=1669834027" /><br><br><br><strong>Lieutenant</strong><br>The most loyal subordinates to the Commander, they are best at controlling the flow of the battle and creating sparks that can turn into a great blaze.<br><img src="https://cdn.akamai.steamstatic.com/steam/apps/2204570/extras/lt_gif.gif?t=1669834027" /><br><br><br><strong>Commander</strong><br>The Commander can fly across the battlefield, turning the tide at any given moment. But be careful, as diving too deep could land you in the enemies trap.<br><img src="https://cdn.akamai.steamstatic.com/steam/apps/2204570/extras/cdr_gif.gif?t=1669834027" />

<GameName>Crispy Puppy</GameName>
<CONTENT>

In one of the abandoned camps, among the forests and old buildings, a creature called Crispy Puppy roams, no one has ever heard of such a camp, and those who have been there do not say anything about it, and only fear is read in their eyes. <br><img src="https://cdn.akamai.steamstatic.com/steam/apps/2203660/extras/1.gif?t=1669739625" /><br>According to legend, under the camp itself there is a huge factory in which terrible human fears are created. <CONTENT>
DICE GAME is a 2D game in which you have to fight in a deadly dice game. Activate the cubes, dodge the DICE deity, complete this game to the end. Get bonuses to improve your abilities. But remember, no one has won this game yet.<br />
<br />
Functions:<br />
music from bolinsoid<br />
-pixel graphics from 8BIT<br />
-character upgrade 8 user reviewsThis game will take your money and time. It won't give you anything in return. Be careful. Don't buy it.

Hunted: Kalevala is made by 3rd year game production students at JAMK, Business Information Technology. Jyväskylä Finland.<br />
Game was made over approximately 4 months, with a lot of hiccups and problems on the way. With no Unreal Engine experience before this project.<br />

Well this game is not what I expected. A single small environment where you fight a single monster. No explanation of what the point of the story for this game is. No clear instructions on buttons. The only way to get out of the middle of the game is a hard exit or you die. The monster and you can glitch on invisible walls or rocks.The game is pretty and the monster looks cool but that is where the positives end. 

Firstly, the game is using 100% of my GPU. Performance aside, it is not clear at all what you're supposed to do. You can't even look up the controls in the options. You are just dropped into the forest with no weapon or any idea of how to make one, while the OST of the Witcher 3 if it was composed and performed by a drunkard blares in the background.

It has potential, but it needs some more work.

Edit:
The good news is that I found the weapons, the bad is the combat is just terrible.

There is a thread in which the creator mentions that they did reach out to the other team asking for permission to borrow the concept which is to clear out several floors that are full of cats.

These levels have their own theme, colour and music. There is one scrollable screen on each floor and a bathroom you have to enter. Now, of the two games this appears to be the lesser one (there are no animations when changing floors) but I enjoyed it just the same. Looking for secret cats that require interaction with objects on our part is just pure fun!

Is it similar to A Building Full of Cats? Indeed it is since the dev was inspired to make this game due to the other game. <CONTENT>
The newest popular match 3 game Keep Sheep is coming! Compete with players from all over the world! Challenge super difficult puzzle!<br />
<br />
Only 0.1% of the players can solve the puzzle and clear the level! It is said that the IQ of those who clear the level is as high as that of Einstein! Come and challenge yourself!<br />
<br />
How to play Keep Sheep:<br />
There is a groove below, a total of 7 blocks can be placed in the groove.<br />
Match three tiles with the same pattern. Clicking on tiles automatically places them in the groove below. When there are 3 tiles of the same pattern in the groove, they will be automatically eliminated.<br />
*Note: Up to 7 moves can be used to remove three tiles with the same pattern in each round! If the groove is full of tiles, it means you fail. Every step matters!<br />
Tiles will have many layers. Only after the tiles on the upper layer are eliminated, the blocks on the lower layer can be eliminated.<br />
When there are no tiles on the grass, you have successfully cleared the level!<br />
<br />

Easy match - Challenge your brain through thousands of mahjong puzzles. classic elimination gameplay. The low difficulty level at the beginning will help you quickly get started, and then puzzles will become challenging! Are you ready? <br />

<strong>Cardiac Powder</strong> is a twin-stick shooter where you have a bomb in you, if you can’t maintain a certain BPM, it will explode… So one thing to do is keep you in action by fighting your opponents! You are a paid assassin, who wakes up with a clear message: “Be fast… or explode!” This threat will be stopped as soon as you accomplish the assigned mission… until the next one…<br><br>So, each assigned mission will force you to clean in a fast way every area that you will have to go to. <br><br><strong>During missions, you will experiment</strong>:<br><ul class="bb_ul"><li>Frenetic action: you will be able to shoot, move fast and dodge bullets, but you won’t be able to stay too calm otherwise you will finish in tiny pieces…<br></li><li>Bullet time: if you play extremely well, your BPM will go very high, which will allow you to surpass human capabilities by going faster than ordinary mortals<br></li><li>Find items to get you through your journey: items like adrenaline syringe will help you to keep your BPM high</li></ul>

</GAME>

<GameId>2203610</GameId>
<GameName>Ants of Duty</GameName>
<CONTENT>
<img src="https://cdn.akamai.steamstatic.com/steam/apps/2203610/extras/Follow.gif?t=1669738693" /><br><img src="https://cdn.akamai.steamstatic.com/steam/apps/2203610/extras/ant.gif?t=1669738693" /><br>Ants of Duty is a strategy game about managing a small colony of ants that find themselves in an unknown territory. You have to help them cope with the huge dangers on their way, such as red ants, wasps and crabs, so that the ants find their way back to their home. Get resources, build an army and defeat enemies.Особенности: a game for the speed of development of the colony, many different opponents, a game with a choice of consequences. PositiveThis is a scam; ignore the positive reviews--they have nothing to do with this 'game' and are completely misleading.  

Where to begin?  The main menu has 2 options:  Play and exit.  No options.  No instructions.  No tutorial.  Once you start the game, its even worse.  No instructions, terrible graphics.  

Gameplay consists of pressing 3 possible buttons (Q, A, and Z) to summon a worker ant (Q) or some fighter ants (the others).  The works automatically (and with about the stupidest AI imaginable) collect a leaf while you 'control' the warrior ants by clicking on them and sending them to attach the enemy 'base' which is always to the right by clicking on it.  No strategy, no depth.  There's one resource (leaves).  You can't build anything except the 3 types of ants.  Can't build any buildings. 

Oh, and usually if you try to select your ants, it takes about a half dozen times before the game registers it.  Imagine a RTS where there's 1 resource, 3 units which have almost nonexistent AI, completely empty levels, asset flip graphics and--somehow--a completely buggy UI that doesn't register your clicks most of the time.  That's 'Ants of Duty'.  Thank goodness for Steam's refund policy.Interesting game where you can feel like a king ant, it's interesting and fun, I advise you this game, there is interesting gameplay, convenient controls, it is not expensive and worth it to try to play, I really liked it
</CONTENT>

<CONTENT>
<h2 class="bb_tag">INTRODUCTION</h2>Crust Crusaders is a shoot 'em up roguelike. You've been abandoned by the rest of your slices and it's your job to find them. Along the way, you'll be rewarded with toppings that offer skills to help you along this journey. The toppings you select effect your abilities. For example, pepperoni gives you a double blaster, while mushrooms give you a shield. Are you ready to find the best topping combination and defeat the evil fruits and veggies and save the planetary pie?<br><br><br><img src="https://cdn.akamai.steamstatic.com/steam/apps/2202770/extras/CC-01.gif?t=1669833575" /><h2 class="bb_tag">GAMEPLAY</h2>Crust Crusaders uses an auto-rotate feature that allows the player to enjoy the game by switching targeting groups without having to manually rotate. Enemies all have their own set of abilities and fall within three categories: Tank, Damage and Support. Tank has higher health and is usually first to engage. Damage has low health but does more damage with projectiles. Support usually hangs in the back and heals.<br><br><br><img src="https://cdn.akamai.steamstatic.com/steam/apps/2202770/extras/banana-zoom.gif?t=1669833575" /><h2 class="bb_tag">TOPPINGS</h2>There are currently 15+ and 6+ sauces that all provide a unique ability to your slice. <GameName>Out of the ground</GameName>
<CONTENT>
Strange things happen on a mysterious island, whence out of nowhere, evil spirits begin to crawl out of the ground and you, the greedy pirate &quot;Redbeard&quot;, are sent to this island to figure out what's wrong. Dark filth is growing in the depths of the island, threatening to turn the entire island into a decaying cemetery of the dead! You have to eradicate all evil spirits, otherwise the island and you will fall.<br />
<br />
The game is a 2D platformer with puzzle elements. Find yourself on the island, travel around the location, destroy enemies, use all available weapons and get to the pirate ship to go further. The game world is divided into different levels, which will open as you progress through the story.<br />
<br />
In Out of the ground, find a way to stop the spread of corruption on the island by fighting hordes of undead, thugs and feel the effects of corruption on yourself.<br />
<br />
Game Features:<br />
- Nice pixel graphics<br />
- Huge game world<br />
- Interesting tasks 
</CONTENT>
</GAME>

<GameId>2202910</GameId>
<GameName>Shadow Lens</GameName>
<CONTENT>
Shadow Lens is a found-footage video game set in the 90s. The game was never finished, its release in 2000 was due to developer negligence. I obtained the original code for the game and ported it to PC for you to play. There is a lot of unused content in the game files that can only be accessed with cheats. <br />
<br />
The game case reads:<br />
--------------------------------------------------<br />
Monsters lurk across your uncle's farm.<br />
Collect tools to unlock new areas.<br />
Upgrade your camera to navigate the darkness.<br />
Find your missing daughter.<br />
Discover what happened to her.<br />
Solve puzzles to get items.<br />
Complete quests for the locals.<br />
Get slimed and try again!<br />
--------------------------------------------------<br />
<br />
The player is thrust into the role of a nameless protagonist tasked with investigating the strange happenings on an old farm. Discover the mystery of what happened to your daughter, Hantu. On the journey finding a plethora of tools and items to aid in her search. For example, your upgradable polaroid camera can be used to aluminate dark spaces. But be careful, because monsters often hide in these areas and are hard to see. To find Hantu, puzzles involving items must be solved. Most items can be interacted with, consumed, or picked up with your hand. Mastery of the tools and consumables is the key to finding Her. Hidden secrets from Cheat Codes to Unlockable areas litter the landscape. It is up to you to find them. Are you brave enough to look within the shadows and find Hantu? 
</CONTENT>
</GAME>

<GameId>2203130</GameId>
<GameName>Levels</GameName>
<CONTENT>
This game is a Virtual Reality First Person target shooting experience. You go through each environment in your elevator and clear the targets. The faster you clear them, the more points you get. Its THAT simple! 3 user reviewsI just can't recommend this freebie. I don't think it works as an aim trainer because the gun model is so bad and I don't know of a single VR game that this would train you for. The "gun model" doesn't even have iron sights. 

Also, this free to play title needs better optimization. I was getting shaky gameplay on my RTX 3080. I literally felt like I was doing target practice in the middle of an LA earthquake. 

It has a few levels. I did the levels several times before the 5 minutes was up so that I could post a review. I just wanted to quit real quick and never play again. Good luck to the dev, with some polish, this may be a good target practice / aim trainer in the future, but it's not there currently.I just can't recommend this freebie. <GameId>2202370</GameId>
<GameName>折镜（prism.im）</GameName>
<CONTENT>
<h2 class="bb_tag">关于“我”</h2>“我”是一个普通人，目前年纪不大，打工人一枚。从小因为各种原因，有用传统纸笔写日记的习惯。直到科技发展、电脑和互联网普及，偶然发现了这款集存储日记、标记日程表、兴趣聊天室及私信聊天等为一体的小众软件，使用起来简约而有质感，便被深深迷住，并成为忠实用户。每天都坚持在上面写日记。<br>深入了解发现，这款软件不仅好用，而且听说它与“棱镜计划”这个地下研究有关，即这款软件是连接平行宇宙的桥梁。我想和另一个自己对话，我想借助他分享的另一个世界在选择上的的分支，指引自己做出更加正确的决定。或者说，我想知道自己生活的另一种可能性。不过可惜，这只是听说的而已，没有事实依据，但我心存敬畏，我相信这种可能。<h2 class="bb_tag">关于“我”的世界</h2>“我”所处的世界和玩家所在的现实世界是一样的，只不过突然多了一款这样的软件，它充满惊喜和意外，导致形成了一个一定意义上的全新的世界。你是该软件的资深用户，使用多年。我们相信你很快就能熟悉并了解。<h2 class="bb_tag">“我”要做什么</h2>游玩过程中，玩家自行且绝对自由的探索这款软件，以更加了解“我”的故事和面对迎来的意外。玩家会经历各种与“我”所处的现实世界强连接的事件，通过聊天及软件里解锁的新功能等，熟悉并了解后，用玩家现实世界的方式自行代入并了解一个全新的世界。<h2 class="bb_tag">游戏特色</h2><strong>以软件方式呈现</strong><br>我们不会有任何游戏教程和玩家指引。我们希望你能保持探索的心，并代入那个“我”，成为以你意识和选择为主，塑造的全新的“我”。<br><br><strong>创新的对话系统</strong><br>游玩过程中根据你的情绪及主观意愿，发挥你的自由意志，谨慎选择你的每一个选项。分支众多，对话间反复拉扯。在软件里的人都是有血有肉的人，他们会帮助你，也许会给你了解更多的信息，但最好不要挑战他们的耐心。；不过也有可能背叛你，也许他们表里不一，软件中的他们和现实中又完全不一样。没有最好的结局，你甚至到不了你最想要的结局，只有最适合你的结局。<br><br><strong>时常乱序的时间线</strong><br>你需要快速代入到“我”这个角色中，快速整理自己过去、现在以及将来所遭遇的事。串在一起后，自己和身边的一切人与事都将鲜活起来。“我”究竟有怎样的故事，发生了什么，为什么和这款软件紧密连接在了一起。<br><br>总之，《折镜》的世界里你会体验到一个全新的现实世界。这款软件的强大之处在于，它是一个意识体，同时也是个日常生活中常用的软件。背后的故事很大，且细思恐极。整个过程重在体验，颠覆以往对声音、美术、画面等曾经对游戏的固有认知。 
</CONTENT>

<GameName>ISO</GameName>
<CONTENT>
<img src="https://cdn.akamai.steamstatic.com/steam/apps/2202510/extras/ISO_Gif01_Optimized.gif?t=1669654540" /><br><br><i>Welcome, exploration unit Nem0-1.</i><br><br>Join Nem0-1, a robot tasked with the mission of <strong>collecting photos</strong> of the life forms of a beautiful, but abandoned and mysterious, post-human planet Earth.<br><strong>Explore </strong>the environment, <strong>find </strong>hidden areas, <strong>discover </strong>all the animals and make sure to take photos of them in different situations to <strong>fill </strong>your Compendium and <strong>unveil </strong>the planet's secret. But be careful, not everything is as you know it, and some creatures might be dangerous...<br><br><img src="https://cdn.akamai.steamstatic.com/steam/apps/2202510/extras/ISO_Gif02.gif?t=1669654540" /><br><br>On your journey you'll stumble upon contamination areas, home to the mysterious V-Creatures. You<strong> can't stay long in these areas</strong>, so you'll have to be quick to snap a pictures of all the V-Creatures and avoid the threats hiding within.<br><br><img src="https://cdn.akamai.steamstatic.com/steam/apps/2202510/extras/ISO_Gif03_Optimized.gif?t=1669654540" /><h2 class="bb_tag">What you will find in this game</h2><img src="https://cdn.akamai.steamstatic.com/steam/apps/2202510/extras/ISO_Gif04_Optimized.gif?t=1669654540" /><br><br><ul class="bb_ul"><li><strong>Free exploration</strong> with walking, running, crouching, crawling and climbing.</li><li>A <strong>complex camera and photo system</strong> with zoom, roll, filters, depth of field and more!</li><li>A <strong>Pro Mode</strong> where you can manually set the ISO, Aperture and Shutter Speed of the camera with realistic responses.</li><li><strong>Lots of animal</strong>s to find, each with multiple behaviours to photograph, <strong>unlocking a different description</strong> that sheds light on the mysteries of the world.</li><li>A <strong>score </strong>system based on <strong>composition rules</strong>.</li><li>A<strong> beautiful world that slightly changes on each play</strong>, full of opportunities to get beautiful photos.</li></ul><br>Please note that ISO is a short experience that lacks a traditional ending. 5 user reviewsGameplay: https://youtu.be/fsjmaoI175g

The pictures do not do it justice, this game is beautiful, my jaw dropped at one point. It's also very fun, i love exploring and looking in every corner so this game suits me perfectly. What i thought would entertain me for 10 minutes, i ended up playing for an hour and a half and i still haven't found everything. If you like exploring or collecting all the objectives i cannot recommend this enough.

Edit: I kind of missed this in my playthrough but you can take some really beautiful pictures in the game, check out the devs on twitter to see some of the bestNice and relaxing game you can spend time in and just explore and take pictures you like.00111110 00100000 01001111 01100010 01101010 01100101 01100011 01110100 00111010 00100000 01001110 01100101 01101101 00110000 00101101 00110001 00001101 00001010 00111110 00100000 01001111 01100010 01101010 01100101 01100011 01110100 01101001 01110110 01100101 00111010 00100000 01000011 01100001 01110000 01110100 01110101 01110010 01100101 00100000 01101100 01101001 01110110 01101001 01101110 01100111 00100000 01100010 01100101 01101001 01101110 01100111 01110011 00100000 01101001 01101110 00100000 01110100 01101000 01100101 00100000 01100001 01101110 01101111 01101101 01100001 01101100 01101111 01110101 01110011 00100000 01111010 01101111 01101110 01100101 00001101 00001010 00111110 00100000 01010011 01110100 01100001 01110100 01110101 01110011 00111010 00100000 01010010 01110101 01101110 01101110 01101001 01101110 01100111

[list][b]Liked:[/b]
[*]+ Availability: the game is free
[*]+ Beautiful graphics
[*]+ Professional camera
[*]+ Lots of living creatures to shoot
[*]+ Open world
[*]+ Pleasant nature sounds
[*]+ Unobtrusive soundtrack
[*]+ Simple controls
[*]+ Lots of filters and camera settings
[*]+ In-game encyclopedia
[*]+ To photograph some creatures, you will need endurance and patience

[b]Did not like:[/b]
[*]- Lack of settings
[*]- A small number of frames available for shooting
[*]- A bug at the beginning of the game: when using the prone position for the first time, the character could not stand up again. Until he fell off the cliff.
[*]- At times, when moving through the vines - the character's head begins to spin wildly.[/list]

[b]Conclusion:[/b]
A great little Indie-game in which the player simply has to explore a small map - and take photos of the animals they encounter. The more beautiful and "correct" the photo is taken, the better it will look in the encyclopedia.
An almost real camera is available to the player - in which he can not only use zoom, but also rotate, filters, and adjust the exposure / contrast of the photo. True, during all the manipulations - time does not stand still, therefore, having set the necessary parameters, the player will have to be patient - in order to catch an interesting frame again.
Not all living creatures in the world are harmless - and can sometimes fight back if the player gapes and gets too close. But do not worry - there is no concept of death in the game - after shutdown, the Robot will be restored at the last boot server.
The game is not big, but it's nice to spend time in it - having a rest from the industrial world in the bosom of nature.
</CONTENT>
</GAME>

<GameId>2202270</GameId>
<GameName>Hunting Life VR: Dove Season</GameName>
<CONTENT>
<strong><u>NOTE</u></strong>: This game requires a Meta / Oculus VR headset and controllers (Rift S or Quest 2 with Link). <br><br><strong><u>Bag your limit in a one-of-a-kind VR experience!</u></strong><br>From one of the designers of the best-selling Deer Hunter and Bird Hunter series of the past comes a thrilling new hunting game, designed and developed from the beginning to be played in VR! <br><br><br><br><u><strong>The Hunt</strong></u><br>Deep in the immersion of virtual reality, keep your eyes peeled for doves and your shotgun at the ready. But be sure that your target is a dove and not a crow or songbird or you’ll have to pay a fine for breaking the game laws! <br><br>Earn money for each dove that you bag and spend your earnings to buy new guns or “power ups” for a day (such as highlighting downed birds to make them easier to see). Choose your shotgun from a wide assortment of pump-action, semi-auto, side-by-side and over-under (in 12ga, 20ga, and .410). <br><br>Bag rare banded birds and see the location where they were banded and the age of the bird on special certificates in your farmhouse. Can you collect all of the 40+ band locations? Other, even more rare, birds await you in the field as well! <br><br><br><u><strong>Your Hunting Land</strong></u><br>Explore as you hunt your own private 550 acre hunting land. This area is dove heaven, containing sunflower fields, hay fields, wooded thickets and stock tanks. You hunt with a full 24 hour day-night cycle, so you can use your headlamp to get to your hunting spot before sunrise or find that bird that you downed just before shooting hours closed at sunset. <br><br>The realistic dove AI means that you are much more likely to find doves feeding in the early morning and evening, roosting through the midday, and sipping water and picking up some gravel in late mornings and early afternoons. <br><br>Doves can follow different patterns on different days, meaning that spot where you bagged your limit on a previous day may not be nearly as busy the next time you hunt. It is important to know where, and when, feeding and watering areas are…and where the birds roost, as you may kick some birds out of their roost by walking through! <br><br><br><u><strong>Hunt Your Way</strong></u><br>Hunting Life VR: Dove Season allows you customize your hunting experience to be what you want it to be. Do you want a realistic hunting experience with just a few doves that can spot you if you’re not in cover? Go for it! Or maybe you prefer tons of doves with no non-game birds? We’ve got you covered! Want to forget about game laws and just go out and have fun bagging birds with no limits? You can do that too!<br><br><br><u><strong>Action Challenge</strong></u><br>When you’ve gotten comfortable with hunting doves in Dove Season, be sure to try out the Action Challenge where you are set in the path of a never-ending flock of doves and you must down as many as you can before time runs out! Special silver and gold doves are worth more points and they add to your time. Stringing hits together will increase your score multiplier. Action Challenge takes it all: speed, accuracy, target recognition! <br><br>Hunting Life VR lets you enjoy the outdoors your way! <br><br><u><strong>Achievements</strong></u><br>Try to obtain 15 different Steam Achievements, including: <br><ul class="bb_ul"><li><strong>Peas in a Pod</strong> - Down two doves that hit the ground within 3 yards of each other. <br></li><li><strong>Double Trouble</strong> - Down two doves within 2 seconds.<br></li><li><strong>Not a Lost Cause</strong> - Bag 100 doves in a row without losing a single bird.</li></ul><br>Achievements are displayed in-game (per save) in the &quot;farm house&quot;. Some special achievements unlock shotgun skins that can only be obtained through earning the achievement! <br><br><strong><u>Lama glama Game Company</u></strong><br>We are an indie game company and we have roots in the game industry, specifically with hunting games. Lama glama founder, Tom Shiflet, served as producer / game designer on the best selling hunting games from Sunstorm Interactive, including the <strong>Deer Hunter</strong>, <strong>Bird Hunter </strong>and <strong>Rocky Mountain Trophy Hunter</strong> series. Hunting Life VR is returning to our roots as game developers…and combining our passions: enjoying the outdoors and video games! We hope that Dove Season is just the first of many seasons that we can bring to you in Hunting Life VR! 1 user reviews[h1]Experienced on the Meta Quest 2[/h1]

You can view my initial impressions & gameplay here: https://youtu.be/8WVSDbPqN78

I think Hunting Life VR has a good concept. A semi-realistic hunting setup which has you specifically hunting for doves. While the concept is neat, the execution is not. I find it difficult to say anything else positive about the experience.

The biggest thing (maybe) is that the visuals are poor, but also the game is poorly optimized. The game also has arcade-like gun mechanic that has you holding the shotgun with one hand. The gun mechanics are poor overall & just not realistic, along with the reloading being very finnicky. The game also has poor sounds & ugly UI.

Game is running on the Unity Engine. On my RTX 3080, I was getting variable frame rates from 40 to 90 fps throughout, although I did have all the graphical options set to max. You do have full locomotion, along with smooth or snap turning. The VR interactions are very basic here. You hold the shotgun in one hand, you spawn a shell in the off hand. You press grab to open the shotgun chamber with your off-hand and holding down. I had to try multiple times to reload the shotgun.

Overall, this game is just too expensive given the lack of polish, visuals, sounds, presentation, etc. I cannot recommend it.

[b]Rate 4/10.[/b]

[quote]Please note: I received a free Steam key through the Steam Curator Connect program. You can join my Steam Curator group, Oculus Rift Reviews, here: https://steamcommunity.com/groups/Oculus_WMR [/quote][h1]Experienced on the Meta Quest 2[/h1]

You can view my initial impressions & gameplay here: https://youtu.be/8WVSDbPqN78

I think Hunting Life VR has a good concept. A semi-realistic hunting setup which has you specifically hunting for doves. While the concept is neat, the execution is not. I find it difficult to say anything else positive about the experience.

The biggest thing (maybe) is that the visuals are poor, but also the game is poorly optimized. The game also has arcade-like gun mechanic that has you holding the shotgun with one hand. The gun mechanics are poor overall & just not realistic, along with the reloading being very finnicky. The game also has poor sounds & ugly UI.

Game is running on the Unity Engine. On my RTX 3080, I was getting variable frame rates from 40 to 90 fps throughout, although I did have all the graphical options set to max. You do have full locomotion, along with smooth or snap turning. The VR interactions are very basic here. You hold the shotgun in one hand, you spawn a shell in the off hand. You press grab to open the shotgun chamber with your off-hand and holding down. I had to try multiple times to reload the shotgun.

Overall, this game is just too expensive given the lack of polish, visuals, sounds, presentation, etc. I cannot recommend it.

[b]Rate 4/10.[/b]

<GameId>2201540</GameId>
<GameName>Alone in the Outback</GameName>
<CONTENT>
<img src="https://cdn.akamai.steamstatic.com/steam/apps/2201540/extras/The_Story.png?t=1669718844" /><br>You find yourself in the Australian outback with the bare minimum to survive. You are surrounded by Australian wildlife and most of it is as deadly as it comes. You have no memory of who you are and how you got here. You also find out that people appear to have abandoned this area. <br><br>Surviving in the Australian outback isn't easy - it is an extremely harsh environment with extreme temperatures, low rainfall, and little vegetation. The water is scarce. You will have to find your own strategy to survive, manage the heat and gather food. <br><br>Who are you and how did you get here?<br><br>Why are you alone?<br><br>Why did people leave this place?<br><br>How do you get back to civilisation?<br><br>And finally, are you really alone...<br><br><img src="https://cdn.akamai.steamstatic.com/steam/apps/2201540/extras/Survival.png?t=1669718844" /><br>Australian wildlife isn't the friendliest in the world. Kangaroos and dingoes can be aggressive, but saltwater crocodiles or the eastern brown snake will most likely cause your death if you get too close to them. <br><br>You will have to develop your own strategy to survive. You can either approach them directly with a weapon you crafted earlier, or you can build traps and prepare poisoned baits. <br><br>However, wildlife isn't your biggest problem. Extreme temperatures and dehydration is what usually kills people stranded in the Australian outback. You must find water. You must find shade. You may consider sleeping through the heat of the day and explore the outback at a night time. Or you can gather as much water as you can and continue exploring. You may carefully plan the trip so you stay shaded for most of it. The choice is entirely up to you. <br><br><img src="https://cdn.akamai.steamstatic.com/steam/apps/2201540/extras/SnakeTrap.gif?t=1669718844" /><br><br><img src="https://cdn.akamai.steamstatic.com/steam/apps/2201540/extras/BuildAndCraft.png?t=1669718844" /><br>Building system allows players to build the shelter as advanced or as simple as they want. It currently includes basic and advanced shelter levels, with a variety of items to chose from.<br><br>In addition to shelter, you will have to craft your weapons, traps, tools, and various other survival items.<br><br><img src="https://cdn.akamai.steamstatic.com/steam/apps/2201540/extras/Construction.gif?t=1669718844" />

<GameName>Rocket Escape</GameName>
<CONTENT>
Rocket Escape is an innovative 2D platformer about rocket jumping your way to the goal. Despite being around in gaming for a long time, rocket jumping is usually relegated to a side mechanic. However, we believed that rocket jumping could be so much more. Featuring mechanics such as slow motion/rocket time, speedrunning timers, black hole rockets, and more, Rocket Escape is an expansion on the time-tested concept of rocket jumping. We at Compact Square Studios have been working on Rocket Escape as a passion project over the last few years, and we are excited to be able to release the game on Steam and share it with the world.<br><br>We look forward to seeing how you approach and enjoy the game!<br><img src="https://cdn.akamai.steamstatic.com/steam/apps/2201680/extras/pickuplaunchersmol.png?t=1670204722" /> 6 user reviewsRocket Escape is a game that takes a lot from Portal.
It's short, it's fun, and it's not something that's really been done before.
For just a few bucks, I'd say it's a great buy.From its inception in 2020 to release in 2022 Rocket Escape has been a labor of love from the burgeoning studio Compact Square. With its simplistic yet detailed art style and portal-esque puzzle levels, Rocket Escape leaves the player not only wanting to finish the game, but also to reach perfection with its level clock. <GAME>
<GameId>2201040</GameId>
<GameName>IN CELL</GameName>
<CONTENT>
IN CELL is a kinetic visual novel (linear, no choices) about the epidemic of sexless, nationless, and friendless men.  Gender dynamics are currently not functional, sustainable, or beneficial to either men or women.  IN CELL is an uncensored conversation between the sexes.  Not that such a conversation will solve anything.<br />
<br />
There are no specific characters, just mostly nameless men, and women.  It is better to think of men and women as the characters rather than specific people.  There are themes of racism, violence, sex, porn, and pretty much anything you could think of that may bother you.  There's a healthy dose of memes too as the subject matter necessitates it.<br />
<br />
You'll enjoy the hot new dating app &quot;Let's **** Chad!&quot;  You'll consider violence a reasonable solution.  You'll hate, you'll love, and you'll be numb.  IN CELL while primarily written by me does include direct quotes of men from youtube, 4chan, reddit, and other corners of the internet.<br />
<br />
IN CELL does not come from a place of wanting to solve the problem.  It is merely a talking point in the form of a visual novel.  I wanted to write about the modern male experience.  I was inspired by innumerable sources that I won't name as they may not want to be associated with this work.  I've read books, watched hundreds of thousands of hours of youtube videos, browsed forums, and have gone outside.<br />
<br />
I, like many other men, do not like this world.  IN CELL is about our experience as men. 
</CONTENT>
</GAME>

<a href="https://steamcommunity.com/linkfilter/?url=https://discord.gg/Qp3cpQ3wbH" target="_blank" rel=" noopener"  ><img src="https://cdn.akamai.steamstatic.com/steam/apps/2201070/extras/Discord_Phylakterion.png?t=1669645062" /></a><br><br>Phylakterion is a co-op psychological horror game, playable for 1-4 people. You and your team enter haunted places to find a possessed item – make sure to stay alert, because the entity possessing it does not take your presence kindly and will try to stop you!<br>Use different tools to locate the possessed item and find out what kind of entity is possessing it – Can you see the item’s reflection in a mirror? Does it scream when you drop it? Does the entity write with the blood of its victims? Then use the right rituals to destroy the vessel before the entity finds you! Can you retain your sanity and finish the task at hand?<br><br>Early Access Features:<br><br><ul class="bb_ul"><li> <strong>3-step exorcism</strong>: Search, identify, destroy!<br></li><li> <strong>5 different locations</strong>: Explore a city apartment, an abandoned mansion, a haunted police station and more!<br></li><li> <strong>7 different tools</strong>: You’ll need ghost hunting equipment, like Geiger-counters, cameras, or notebooks, to locate the vessel, identify the ghost possessing it, and destroy it!<br></li><li> <strong>1-4 players</strong>: play alone or with your friends.<br></li><li> <strong>Unique entities</strong>: Stay alert and adjust your strategy to the situation, as every entity behaves differently.<br></li><li> <strong>Afterlife</strong>: You might die if you’re not careful, but you can still be helpful to your team!</li></ul>

<GAME>
<GameId>2201110</GameId>
<GameName>Sotidrokhima</GameName>
<CONTENT>
<img src="https://cdn.akamai.steamstatic.com/steam/apps/2201110/extras/ezgif.com-gif-maker__2_.gif?t=1669264268" /><br><br><strong><i>13th century AD - LANDS OF THE FINNISH TRIBES, IN MODERN-DAY FINLAND</i></strong><br><br>Many have tried, yet equally many have failed.<br>The lands of the Finnish tribes in the far north are hard to conquer, but under the pretext of spreading Christianity among pagans, the neighboring Swedes aim to invade. When the old gods are threatened and the old believers face suppression and death, the tribesmen rise up for their homeland. But against such a powerful foe, ordinary warriors may not be enough. People need heroes...<br>...heroes, like Sotidrokhima!<br>But while the Swedish invasion seems imminent, ancient powers are simultaneously lifting their heads in the deep reaches of the land, waiting to instill their power and fury on their ancestral domains once more...<br><br><i>Sotidrokhima</i> is a story-driven hack-and-slash with simple character progression. As the titular folk-hero from Karelia, Finland, you must fight your way through hordes of enemies using anything from sword to bows to javelins - and renowned weapons of the Finnish gods themselves.<br><br><img src="https://cdn.akamai.steamstatic.com/steam/apps/2201110/extras/ezgif.com-gif-maker__1_.gif?t=1669264268" /><br><br><ul class="bb_ul"><li>Mixture of top-down and first-person action<br></li><li>Relentless combat: take human shields, use adrenaline attacks to devastate hordes of enemies...<br></li><li>Renown mechanic: the better you fight, the more famous and feared you will become, gaining rewards like unlockable weapons, hidden dialogue, and your enemies running away in fear<br></li><li>Five mini-games to gain experience and improve your character's qualities<br></li><li>Customizable Difficulty - including Permadeath!<br></li><li>Blood, gore, and lots of them!</li></ul> 4 user reviewsJust beat the game after I was gifted it by a friend. 

Two words: Finnish Anime.

Definitely an enjoyable time to stream for some friends but you may want a few drinks, too. It's almost like fan-fiction of itself.

Constructive criticisms as of 11/25/2022:
1. Melee range is MUCH too far, it feels like enemies slap you from across the map.

2. The combat aiming cursor is frustrating, to put it lightly. It needs to show exactly where the mouse is or keep the same rotational speed regardless of distance from the middle of the screen, and lock the mouse to the screen. I found myself clicking off of the game mid-combat which was driving me nuts.

3. Adding use of the number pad in first-person fights would help a lot, those are hard. Increase time between block and attack a little. (Honestly, I'd replace it with just W, A, S, D, and Spacebar instead of 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 0, Spacebar.)

4. The enemies in the final boss fight do too much damage and attack WAY too fast, don't even try to get close to them.It was $2 well spent. I had a great time with it. Then I spent another $2 to buy it for a friend. 

The art style is very unique but it made me smile.

The game is BRUTALLY difficult. The melee range is very long and there aren't any swipe vfx or anything to tell how far melee swings are. Some visual effects would really help so you could see the swings. The melee enemies don't really have a 'tell' for when they attack, so melee back and forth combat is very difficult. The aiming is really weird. The cursor is used to aim, but the cursor is invisible. If the cursor was visible, the aiming style would work a lot better. Please make the cursor visible. 

The hand to hand combat sequences are fun but I think a Guitar Hero/Rhythm game style where the number drops down on a track would be a little more fun. The pauses between the enemy's attacks are very inconsistent and sometimes there are long pauses where they don't attack at all.

The mini games for upgrades don't have a "help" screen or tutorial, and some are very confusing (the sauna for example). And if you fail the mini game, you don't get an upgrade, which feels pretty bad. 

The HP and ammo types are all just text on the screen, I'd love to see actual UI icons. Hearts instead of numbers for health, bow and arrow icon with a number next to it for arrow ammo, etc.

The cutscenes and storyline was the real star of the show. It was a ton of fun to see.This game is really hard. Just like me when watching 'em manly cutscenes.

I hate the duels, they're super annoying giving you little next to no time to think. Getting to finish your opponent after is satisfying thoBoth people who reviewed this game are psychopaths and cannot be trusted. Do not believe their lies

<CONTENT>
Distributor simulator is open world, third person game. You are company owner and here you have to buy goods al lowest possible price, load it to your car and deliver it to shops.  Increase your level and unlock more contracts with other shops and Companys for different cargos. Buy trailers or bigger vehicles to increase load capacity and earn bigger profit. Plan routes to lower fuel costs. Simulator running in cycles. You will get different prices in every cycle. After some time you will notice what price is high, what price is low so you can buy more goods on cheap and store it in your warehouse for next delivery. Eventually became successful merchant and earn your first million.<br />

<GameName>Cowboys & Zombies VR</GameName>
<CONTENT>
Cowboys and Zombies... What can go wrong?<br />
<br />
Prove that you are the fastest gunslinger in the old west by literally shooting with your bare hands. You have to be quick or the zombies will eat you...<br />
<br />
The game has two modes: Story mode and Hands tracking or Time mode.<br />
In the story mode the player can move freely around the stage, he will have to find the way to go to the next level.<br />
<br />
In hands tracking mode, the player remains static in one position, having to survive the zombie attack for a certain amount of time. You can use the Quest, Quest 2 and Quest Pro goal cameras, to play, you do not need controllers. Playing without controllers is less accurate, but can be more fun...<br />

<GameId>2200670</GameId>
<GameName>Forge of Destiny</GameName>
<CONTENT>
Faced with the impossibility of halting the extinction of humanity, a planetary contingency plan was activated for the relocation and protection of the surviving people. Promoted and financed by the world's leading technology company of the time, Inductrack, a program was devised to build colossal metropolis contained in domes or vaults, which would be known as Nodes or dome-cities.<br><br>Although originally there were more than three thousand Nodes, the number of operational dome-cities is not known at present. Political instability and constant internal conflicts, as well as the altercations that occurred during the insurrection of the rebel coalition of Diurna against the government of the Regency of Omnis, provoked confrontations that, in many cases, ended with the total destruction of the structures that provide vital support to the domes.<br><br>Gradually, the idea of finding another way of life fell into oblivion. The Nodular Governments rewrote the events of the past to maintain absolute control over the inhabitants of the dome-cities, who submitted to the idea of isolation and the impossibility of leaving their own Nodes, believing that there was no existence but themselves.<h2 class="bb_tag">The control of truth</h2>.<br>At present, VΣRÐΔÐ is the only truth that exists. The citizens of the Nodes are engaged in the search for arcana in order to increase their influence and thus acquire privileges based on their reputation. Meanwhile, Diurna maintains her combative spirit, organizing assaults and skirmishes, hoping that, one day, the scales will finally tip in her favor.<h2 class="bb_tag">1st Chapter</h2><br>Enter the universe of &quot;Forge of Destiny&quot; as an inhabitant of the Fourth Node-capital. Discover the secrets hidden in the sands of the ruin district and witness the beginning of your story. A project funded by the COTEC Foundation and developed by the Video Game Laboratory Nodo Play.

<CONTENT>
The year is 1981. Seven years since some strange disease ripped through the city of Sennenmoor, a quarantine cutting it off from the world. Seven years that have seen it forgotten, left to rot amongst the moorland. Five years since you last saw him. Five happy years together and then, suddenly, five years apart. No warning. One day he was just gone.<br>Three weeks since the letter. Written in shaking hand, though undeniably his. Still the smell of him hanging a little on the paper, still the letters slanting more as they went on, rushed and desperate. <br>Two weeks since you took a job as a research scientist in a dead and broken city, for you knew where the letter came from, though you didn't know how, nor how he'd gotten back. The city of his birth, the city he often said he wanted to go back to, one day, to stay, to live out your lives there.<br>Two hour since you took a military train southbound from Glasgow towards Sennenmoor. A letter in your breast pocket. On it, written in scrawled hand, the words;<br><i>We're going home, Elias.</i><br><br><i>Now You Would Destroy The Earth</i> is a top-down psychological horror narrative adventure about a man seeking answers from a lover he thought long gone, across the backdrop of a city torn apart by a strange disease. With multiple endings, paths and secrets to find, converse and navigate your way through the broken streets of Sennenmoor to find the truth about the man you once loved, and the nature of the disease itself.

Red - Improves damage.<br />
